Variable Name: Compensation required for or economic assessment required before regulatory taking (stricter than federal standard)? (=2 if both, =1 if one of the two, =0 if neither, multiplied by 0.5 if applies to state government only, not localities)
Source1 Name: John D. Echevarria and Thekla Hansen-Young (2008), "The Track Record on Takings Legislation: The Results from Florida and Oregon," Planning and Environmental Law 60 (11).
Data Location/Table Source2: Regulatory Takings and Private Property Rights
Source3 Name: Kirk Emerson and Charles R. Wise (1997), "Statutory Approaches to Regulatory Takings: State Property Rights Legislation Issues and Implications for Public Administration," Public Administration Review 57 (5): 411-422.
Source4 Name: Bill Peacock, "Property Rights in Texas: Heading in the Right Direction"

Variable Name: State Wetland Restoration Program (=1 if yes)
Source2 Name: ELI Study of State Wetlands Programs

Variable Name: Wetland Regulatory Protection Statutes, Stricter than Federal (=1 if statewide, =0.5 if local/coastal, =0 if none)
Data Location/Table Source1: State Wetland Programs - links to descriptions of state regulatory frameworks
Source2 Name: ELI Study of State Wetlands Programs

Variable Name: Endangered Species Act Statutes Animals Plants (=0 if no act or statute, =1 if act or statute, but only in regard to animals, =2 if act or statute in regard to both animals and plants)
Data Location/Table Source1: Map of State Endangered Species Laws

Variable Name: Guidelines for a State Development Plan (=0 if none, =1 if yes but no land-use element, =2 if yes and include land-use element)
Source1 Name: Institute for Business and Home Safety
Source3 Name: Institute for Business and Home Safety

Variable Name: Strength of State Planning Role (=1 if weak, =2 if significant, =3 if substantial)
Source1 Name: Institute for Business and Home Safety
Source3 Name: Institute for Business and Home Safety

Variable Name: State Mandated Local Plans (=1 if yes)
Source1 Name: Institute for Business and Home Safety
Source3 Name: Institute for Business and Home Safety

Variable Name: Internal Consistency (=1 if state imposes requirement that zoning be based upon and consistent with the legally adopted comprehensive plan)
Source1 Name: Institute for Business and Home Safety
Data Location/Table Source2: Maps from the Summary of State Land Use Planning Laws
Source3 Name: Institute for Business and Home Safety

Variable Name: Vertical Consistency (=0 if none, =1 if state merely assists localities, =2 if state imposes requirement that the local comprehensive plan of a city or county not conflict with plans of higher levels of government within the state)
Source1 Name: Institute for Business and Home Safety
Data Location/Table Source2: Maps from the Summary of State Land Use Planning Laws
Source3 Name: Institute for Business and Home Safety

Variable Name: Horizontal Consistency (=0 if none required, =1 if state merely assists localities, =2 if state requires intergovernmental coordination among neighboring jurisdictions)
Source1 Name: Institute for Business and Home Safety
Data Location/Table Source2: Maps from the Summary of State Land Use Planning Laws
Source3 Name: Institute for Business and Home Safety

Variable Name: Gasoline tax rate per gallon in dollars, including sales, excise, and franchise taxes
Data Location/Table Source1: State Sales, Gasoline, Cigarette, and Alcohol Taxes (note: gas taxes as of April in year following that coded herein)
Data Location/Table Source2: State Gasoline Tax Rates, As of January 1, 2011

Variable Name: Consumer Price Index, All Items, Annual
fgastax1*201.6 [2006 value]/tcpi
Active cap on greenhouse gas emissions from electric power producers? (1=yes, 0=no) (note: setting a goal or initiating a process doesn't count - only actual regulations in force)
Source3 Name: Erica Martinson, "Cap and Trade Lives on Through the States," Politico (May 27, 2014)

Variable Name: Wharton Residential Land Use Regulatory Index
Source1 Name: Joseph Gyourko, Albert Saiz, and Anita Summers (2008), "A New Measure of the Local Regulatory Environment for Housing Markets: The Wharton Residential Land Use Regulatory Index," Urban Studies 45 (3): 693-729.

Variable Name: Local rent control laws exist? (1=yes, 0=no)

Mandated free speech on private property? (3=malls, universities, & neighborhood associations, 2=malls & neighborhood associations or malls & universities, 1=malls or universities, 0.5=some government connection required/signature gathering only, 0=none)
Source1 Name: Eugene Volokh, "State Constitutional Free Speech vis-à-vis Private Landowners," Volokh.com, June 13, 2012.

Variable Name: state cost of living, 2007 vintage
Source1 Name: Berry, W.D., Fording, R.C., Hanson, R.L., 2000. An annual cost of living index for the american states, 1960-1995. Journal of Politics 62, 550–567.

Variable Name: state implicit price deflator, index year 2008
Source2 Name: Bettina H. Aten, Eric B. Figueroa, and Troy M. Martin (2013), "Real Personal Income and Regional Price Parities for States and Metropolitan Areas, 2007–2011," Survey of Current Business (August): 89-103.
Data Location/Table Source2: RPP's from Table 4 used to calculate IRPD's for 2007

Variable Name: state price parities
Source2 Name: Bettina H. Aten, Eric B. Figueroa, and Troy M. Martin (2013), "Real Personal Income and Regional Price Parities for States and Metropolitan Areas, 2007–2011," Survey of Current Business (August): 89-103.

Variable Name: enacted eminent domain reform through legislation or initiative, or court decision putting strict limits on "public use" (=1 if yes, 0 if no, including judicial action)
Data Location/Table Source1: 50 State Report Card: Tracking Eminent Domain Reform Legislation Since Kelo
Source2 Name: Elizabeth F. Gallagher (2005), "Breaking New Ground: Using Eminent Domain for Economic Development," 73 Fordham L. Rev. 1837 2004-2005.

Variable Name: private property (=1 if prohibits private property taking for any private use, regardless of alleged public benefit, =0.5 if prohibits only some private-to-private transfers, =0 if no effective restrictions on this type of eminent domain use)
Data Location/Table Source1: 50 State Report Card: Tracking Eminent Domain Reform Legislation Since Kelo
Source2 Name: Elizabeth F. Gallagher (2005), "Breaking New Ground: Using Eminent Domain for Economic Development," 73 Fordham L. Rev. 1837 2004-2005.
Source3 Name: Ilya Somin (2013), "Interesting Missouri Supreme Court Decision Interpreting the State’s Post-Kelo Eminent Domain Reform Law," Volokh Conspiracy

Variable Name: blight (=1 if implemented stricter definition either explicitly or implicitly, =0.5 if retained vague definition but required higher standard of proof, =0 if otherwise)
Data Location/Table Source1: 50 State Report Card: Tracking Eminent Domain Reform Legislation Since Kelo
Source2 Name: Elizabeth F. Gallagher (2005), "Breaking New Ground: Using Eminent Domain for Economic Development," 73 Fordham L. Rev. 1837 2004-2005.

Variable Name: Constitution enshrines all additional restrictions on eminent domain (=1 if yes,=0 if no, =0.5 if only some restrictions on ED have been codified constitutionally)
Data Location/Table Source1: 50 State Report Card: Tracking Eminent Domain Reform Legislation Since Kelo
Source2 Name: Elizabeth F. Gallagher (2005), "Breaking New Ground: Using Eminent Domain for Economic Development," 73 Fordham L. Rev. 1837 2004-2005.

Variable Name: Eminent domain reform index ((freform+fprivate+fblight)*(1+(0.5*fconst)))

Mandatory renewable portfolio standard for electric utilities: if yes, minimum percentage of retail sales for which required; if no, zero (halved if applies only to investor-owned utilities, or averaged among standards for all types of utilities)
Source1 Name: Database of State Incentives for Renewables & Efficiency
Source2 Name: Center for American Progress (2009), "A Renewable Energy Standard: The Proof is in the States"

Variable Name: Renewable portfolio standard exceptions (1.5=large hydropower excluded, 0.5=natural gas or nuclear included, 1=otherwise)
Source1 Name: Database of State Incentives for Renewables & Efficiency
Source2 Name: Center for American Progress (2009), "A Renewable Energy Standard: The Proof is in the States"

Variable Name: Renewable portfolio standard index (frenew*frpsexc)
